title: 103_hr5040
content: The Act may be cited as the "Education in Vocational Technology Act". The "Education in Vocational Technology Act" aims to improve technical education for high school graduates and young job seekers to meet the demands of technological advancements and global competition. This includes enhancing instruction in manufacturing and vocational technologies to equip workers with the necessary skills for the future workplace. The Act aims to provide grants to States to improve instruction in manufacturing and vocational technologies and purchase state-of-the-art equipment for technical vocational education. The Secretary is authorized to make grants to States for improving instruction in manufacturing and occupational technologies. States must submit an application to receive a grant, with no more than 10% of the grant used for administrative costs. At least 90% of the grant amount must be distributed to local educational agencies. Local educational agencies can apply for grants through the State Board of Vocational Education, with a focus on equitable distribution among urban and rural areas. Administrative costs for the grants are limited to 5%. $100,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 1995 to 1999 for this program. "Grants for equipment are available through the State Board of Vocational Education, with a focus on equitable distribution among urban and rural areas." The Secretary is authorized to make grants to States for purchasing state-of-the-art equipment for technical vocational education. States must submit an application to receive a grant, with not more than 10 percent allowed for administrative costs. At least 90 percent of the grant amount must be distributed to local areas by the State Board of Vocational Education. The State Board of Vocational Education distributes grants to local educational agencies, ensuring equitable distribution among urban and rural areas. Up to 5 percent of the grant can be used for administrative costs. $100,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 1995 to 1999 for this purpose. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education. The term "local educational agency" has the same meaning as in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The term "State Board of Vocational Education" is the sole State agency responsible for the administration or supervision of the State vocational education program.
